title: 10.2 Into the air - kgt34
description: Deze les valt onder de arrangeerbare leerlijn van de Stercollecties voor Engels voor vmbo kgt, leerjaar 3 en 4. Dit is thema 10 'Science and technology'. Het onderwerp van deze les is: Into the air. Deze les gaat over vliegen, waarbij de uitvinding van het vliegtuig wordt besproken en de personen die voor het eerst vlogen. Daarbij ook de 'flying bicycle' besproken. De spreekopdracht gaat over wetenschap en technologie. De onregelmatige werkwoorden van deze les zijn: to drive, to eat en to fall. In de grammaticaopdracht worden de perfect tenses (present perfect en past perfect )behandeld.

items.content:
Het onderwerp van dit blok is vliegen.

  • Maak groepjes van drie of vier leerlingen.

Bespreek de volgende vragen in jouw groepje:

  • Wanneer heeft de mens voor het eerst in een vliegtuig gevlogen?
  • Wie waren de eerste vliegtuigpioniers?
  • Hoe zou een vliegende fiets eruit kunnen zien?
  • Maak een lijst van Engelse woorden die met vliegtuigen te maken hebben.

Bekijk hieronder de stappen die je gaat zetten.

You are going to watch a video from the programme Bang goes the theory.

  • Watch the video and do assignment 1.
  • Read the questions.
  • Watch the video again and do assignment 2.

Assignment 1

Watch the video and answer the question on your own, then discuss the answer in your group.

  • How many people are involved in presentor Jem Stansfield's experiment?

prompt.body:
Choose the right answer.

What is the problem after the first attempt to fly?

content.body: The wind is too strong.
The wings are not curved enough.
The steering and speed aren't good enough.

prompt.body: What does Jem have to do to fly?

content.body: He has to pedal a bit harder.
He has to change the pedals.
He has to pedal slowly.

prompt.body: What does Jem say after the second attempt?

content.body: All I can think about is pedalling a bit harder during another attempt.
All I can think about is saving those wings for another attempt.
All I can think about is saving the pedals for another attempt.

prompt.body: Why did Jem jump of the plane?

content.body: He didn't want to damage the plane.
He thought the plane was too fragile.
He thought the wings couldn't hold him.

prompt.body: What does Jem intend to do during the next attempt?

content.body: He wants to have the courage to steer better.
He wants to have the courage to cling on when it stops.
He wants to have the courage to keep on pedalling.

prompt.body: What happens after the second attempt?

content.body: They go back to the hangar to repair the damage.
They go back to the hangar to change the wheels.
They go back to the hangar to have a break.

prompt.body: What is the problem after the second attempt?

content.body: Jem didn't pedal fast enough.
Jem has to learn how to steer the airplane.
Jem has little control over the airplane at low speed.

prompt.body: Why do they have only one hour left to do the experiment?

content.body: The time to do the experiment has finished.
Jem has to go to another experiment.
The airfield opens in about one hour.

prompt.body: What does Jem conclude during the experiment?

content.body: He concludes that with each run he gets faster and faster.
He concludes that there is not enough wind.
He concludes that he doesn't like flying.

prompt.body: When does Jem succeed to fly?

content.body: During the third attempt.
During the fourth attempt.
During the fifth attempt.

prompt.body: How many times did they try to fly the plane?

content.body: Three times.
Four times.
Five times.

prompt.body: What does Jem say in the end?

content.body: A normal man can actually fly.
A normal guy can actually fly.
A normal bloke can actually fly.

items.content:
Aviation pioneers

You are going to read a text about the brothers who invented airplanes.

  • Read the text and do assignment 1.
  • Read the text again and do assignment 2.

Assignment 1

  • On your own read the text and think of headings (tussenkopjes) for the numbers 1-4.
  • In your group discuss your headings.

Aviation pioneers

The Wright brothers were two American aviation pioneers generally credited with inventing, building, and flying the world's first successful airplane. Wilbur was born on April 16, 1867 and died on May 30, 1912. Orville, his younger brother was born on August 19, 1871 and died on January 30, 1948.

1 ...

They made the first controlled, sustained flight of a powered, heavier-than-air aircraft with the Wright Flyer on December 17, 1903. In 1904-05, the brothers developed their flying machine to make longer-running and more aerodynamic flights with the Wright Flyer II, followed by the first truly practical fixed-wing aircraft, the Wright Flyer III. The Wright brothers were also the first to invent aircraft controls that made fixed-wing powered flight possible.

2 ...

The brothers' breakthrough was their creation of a control system, which enabled the pilot to steer the aircraft effectively and to maintain its equilibrium.This method remains standard on fixed-wing aircraft of all kinds. From the beginning of their aeronautical work, the Wright brothers focused on developing a reliable method of pilot control as the key to solving "the flying problem". This approach differed significantly from other experimenters of the time who put more emphasis on developing powerful engines. Using a small home-built wind tunnel, the Wrights also collected more accurate data than any before, enabling them to design more efficient wings and propellers Their first U.S. patent did not claim invention of a flying machine, but a system of aerodynamic control that manipulated a flying machine's surfaces.

3 ...

The brothers gained the mechanical skills essential to their success by working for years in their Dayton, Ohio-based shop with printing presses, bicycles, motors, and other machinery. Their work with bicycles, in particular, influenced their belief that an unstable vehicle such as a flying machine could be controlled and balanced with practice. From 1900 until their first powered flights in late 1903, they conducted extensive glider tests that also developed their skills as pilots. Their shop employee Charlie Taylor became an important part of the team, building their first airplane engine in close collaboration with the brothers.

4 ...

The Wright brothers' status as inventors of the airplane has been subject to counter-claims by various parties. Much controversy persists over the many competing claims of early aviators. Edward Roach, historian for the Dayton Aviation Heritage National Historical Park, argues that they were excellent self-taught engineers who could run a small company, but they did not have the business skills or temperament to dominate the growing aviation industry.

Source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wright_brothers

Assignment 2

  • Answer the questions on your own.
  • Discuss your answers in your group.
  • Check your answers on the Answers page.

Questions

  1. Why are the Wright brothers famous?
  2. When did they make their first controlled flight?
  3. How many Flyers did they build?
  4. What was their breakthrough?
  5. What was the difference with other experimenters?
  6. How did the Wright brother know what to develop?
  7. Where did they live?
  8. What did they do for a living?
  9. How did they become good pilots?
  10. Who helped them with their inventions?

Answers

Bestudeer de woordenlijst.

Woordenlijst Into the air


Tip!
Er zijn verschillende manieren om woordjes te leren.
Je kunt de woorden hardop voorlezen of overschrijven.
Het belangrijkste is dat je dit niet te lang achter elkaar doet, want dan leer je niets meer.
In twee keer 10 minuten leer je meer dan in een half uur.

Irregular Verbs

Bestudeer de volgende drie irregular verbs (onregelmatige werkwoorden):

  • to drive
  • to eat
  • to fall

Doe de opdrachten.

content.body:
Sleep de woorden naar de juiste plaats in de tabel.

How many attempts did Jem make to fly?

Hoeveel heeft Jem ondernomen om te vliegen?

The experiment is done on the runway.

Het experiment is uitgevoerd op de .

The wings are curving as planned.

De zijn gekromd zoals bedoeld.

The plane is very fragile.

Het vliegtuis is erg .

Fortunately there is no major damage.

Gelukkig is er geen grote .

Jem has little control over the airplane at low speed.

Op heeft Jem weinig controle over het vliegtuig.

The airfield opens in an hour.

Het gaat over een uur open.

The Wright brothers were two American aviation pioneers.

De gebroeders Wright waren twee Amerikaanse .

They invented the first airplane.

Ze hebben het eerste vliegtuig .

They made the first sustained flight.

Ze maakten de eerste vlucht.

They invented the fixed-wing aircraft.

Ze hebben het uitgevonden.

Pilots were able to steer the aircraft.

Piloten konden het vliegtuig .

Pilots were able to maintain the plane's equilibrium.

Piloten konden het vliegtuig in houden.

The brothers did a lot of aeronautical work.

De broers hebben veel werk gedaan in de .

Others developed powerful engines.

De anderen ontwikkelden krachtige .

They controlled the balance of an unstable vehicle.

Ze konden een onstabiel in balans houden.

They conducted extensive glider test.

Ze deden uitgebreide testen met .

The brothers built the airplanes in collaboration with Charlie Taylor.

De broers bouwden de vliegtuigen Charlie Tayor.
They were excellent self-taught engineers. Ze waren geweldige werktuigbouwkundigen.

items.content:
Grammar: Verb tenses

In dit thema herhalen we de werkwoordstijden.

  • Lees de uitleg in de kennisbank.
  • Maak de opdracht.

Perfect tenses

content.body:
Fill in the correct verb - Past participle

Julie wasn't at home, she had (to go) to the shops.

Fill in the correct verb - Past participle

We've already (to have) lunch.

Fill in the correct verb - Past participle

This was the first time she had (to do) her homework.

Fill in the correct verb - Past participle

They have (to begin) painting the living room.

Fill in the correct verb - Past participle

We have (to keep) this secret for three years.

Fill in the correct verb - Past participle

He has never (to drive) a motorbike before.

Fill in the correct verb - Past participle

I have (to be) sick all week.

Fill in the correct verb - Past participle

By the time we arrived, the children had (to eat) all the chocolate.

Fill in the correct verb - Past participle

The books had (to fall) off the table and were all over the floor.

Fill in the correct verb - Past participle

"Are you okay?" "I've (feel) better".

items.content:
Talking about Science and technology part 1

Choose five questions to discuss in your group.

  1. Do you think that science and technology are interesting subjects?
  2. Which new technologies that have emerged over the last fifteen to twenty years have had the most impact on our lives?
  3. What is the most important invention of the last century?
  4. Do you think robots can take over human work?
  5. Do you think that robots are able to fly airplanes?
  6. What are the most recent technological developments which have appeared in cars?
  7. What are the most recent technological developments which have appeared in airplanes?
  8. How many technological devices do you have with you at this moment? What are they?
  9. How would your life change if all your technological devices were taken away for a week?
  10. What is your opinion of scientists? Do you think they are boring people or interesting?

Flying bicycle

Je hebt een video van het Britse programma Bang goes the theory - Flying bicycle gezien.

  • Maak de schrijfopdracht eerst alleen, daarna vergelijk je jouw e-mail met die van je groepsgenoten.
  • Schrijf een e-mail met je groepje en lever deze in bij je docent.

Je gaat een e-mail schrijven aan je penvriend(in) in Engeland.

Verwerk de volgende punten:

  • Bedenk een naam voor je penvriend(in).
  • Groet je penvriend(in).
  • Vertel welke video je gezien hebt. (denk aan de luisteropdracht van deze les)
  • Vertel met wie je de video hebt gezien. (zelf verzinnen)
  • Beschrijf wat er in de video gebeurt.
  • Vertel wat je interessant vond aan de video.
  • Vraag wat je penvriend(in) hiervan vindt.
  • Verzin zelf iets om aan je penvriend(in) te schrijven.
  • Schrijf een passend slot.
  • Schrijf je naam onder de e-mail.

Vul het schema in en beantwoord de vragen onder het schema.

Activiteit leuk niet leuk makkelijk moeilijk weet ik al nieuw
Listening

Writing

  • Waar moet ik nog aan werken?
  • Wat moet ik nog aan mijn docent vragen?

A better view

You are going to listen to a science rap about the world revealed through science and technology. It starts in outer space with the birth of the universe, then comes down to Earth before describing some things we have learnt about ourselves.

What things we have learnt are mentioned in this video?
Watch the video.
